TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit Partitioner`1<TSource> extends System.Object
generic <typename TSource> public ref class Partitioner abstract

Docs.typeparam: Type of the elements in the collection.
Docs.summary: Represents a particular manner of splitting a data source into multiple partitions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md).
## Examples The following example shows how to implement a partitioner that returns a single element at a time:
[!code-csharp[System.Collections.Concurrent.Partitioner#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.collections.concurrent.partitioner/cs/partitioner.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Collections.Concurrent.Partitioner#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.collections.concurrent.partitioner/vb/partitioner.vb#1)]

Docs.threadsafe: The static methods on are all thread-safe and may be used concurrently from multiple threads. However, while a created partitioner is in use, the underlying data source should not be modified, whether from the same thread that is using a partitioner or from a separate thread.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.related: Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<!TSource> GetDynamicPartitions() cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetDynamicPartitions () As IEnumerable(Of TSource)
abstract member GetDynamicPartitions : unit -> seq<'Source> override this.GetDynamicPartitions : unit -> seq<'Source>

Docs.summary: Creates an object that can partition the underlying collection into a variable number of partitions.
Docs.returns: An object that can create partitions over the underlying data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The returned object implements the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface. Calling <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601.GetEnumerator%2A> on the object creates another partition over the sequence.
The <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.Partitioner%601.GetDynamicPartitions%2A> method is only supported if the <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.Partitioner%601.SupportsDynamicPartitions%2A> property returns true. For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md).

Docs.exception: Dynamic partitioning is not supported by the base class. You must implement it in a derived class.
Docs.related: Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1<!TSource>> GetPartitions(int32 partitionCount) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetPartitions (partitionCount As Integer) As IList(Of IEnumerator(Of TSource))

Docs.param: The number of partitions to create.
Docs.summary: Partitions the underlying collection into the given number of partitions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A class that implements this method is expected to return exactly the number of partitions that are specified in `partitionCount`. If a partition contains no elements, then return an empty enumerator rather than null (Nothing in Visual Basic). For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md).

Docs.related: Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property SupportsDynamicPartitions As Boolean
public: virtual property bool SupportsDynamicPartitions { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets whether additional partitions can be created dynamically.
Docs.value: if the can create partitions dynamically as they are requested; if the can only allocate partitions statically.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If a derived class does not override and implement <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.Partitioner%601.GetDynamicPartitions%2A>, <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.Partitioner%601.SupportsDynamicPartitions%2A> should return false. The value of <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.Partitioner%601.SupportsDynamicPartitions%2A> should not vary over the lifetime of this instance. For more information, see [Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL](~/docs/standard/parallel-programming/custom-partitioners-for-plinq-and-tpl.md).

Docs.related: Custom Partitioners for PLINQ and TPL
